page.title: 01IRONBRIDGE, TELFORD, SALOP.
page.content: {Ironbridge and Coalbrookdale} form part of the new town of Telford, Shropshire.It was at Coalbrookdale in 1709 where Abraham Darby 1 smelted iron using coke instead of charcoal and began the Industrial Revolution. The Ironbridge, spanning the river Severn, is a permanent symbol of those times. Under the influence of the Ironbridge Gorge Museum Trust, modern Ironbridge, the little town which grew up around the bridge, is now a centre for tourism, made more accessible by the recent opening of the M54. Encouraged by tourism, local crafts are flourishing. From near dereliction in the post war period, the properties are now renovated, extended and desirable. Modern features include Ironbridge Power Station and the specially created Dale End Park.
